title.narrative: Leading the Change: Civil Society, Rights and Environment - WWF Zambia

description.narrative:
Exit strategy for 2018 to 2019

Support under “Leading the Change” to WWF Zambia and partners will be phased out over 2018 and 2019. Focus will be in joint harvesting of the outcomes of the projects so far and achieving consensus in a co-design approach on what to take forward.WWF Zambia has prioritized the development of a forest programme and a renewable energy programme and will be working with the partners from the programme to discuss this further and develop consensus. Partners will be supported to develop their own exit or transition strategies as the case may be. Three CSOs will be provided with sub-grants for the exit strategies. During the training especially for resource mobilisation, more CSOs will be supported.


The objectives/outcomes from implementing this exit strategy are;

  • By 2019, at least 3 CSO partners have enhanced their institutional and technical capacity for sustainability including increased capacity for fundraising
  • By 2019, lessons from the 2014-2017 Sida support are documented, shared and used in the development of renewable energy and forestry programmes by WWF and partner CSOs.


Three CSOs are proposed to receive financial support based on WWF assessment of the performance and scope of work of the CSOs as well as the level of partnerships and CBOs they have to support. All the CSOs will use part of the funds to produce their own exit strategies.

It is envisaged that once the consultations and validation of outcomes has been achieved, part of the modalities for implementation will be for the partners to state their needs in line with the institutional and technical assessments undertaken. This will result in agreeing funding levels and sub-granting schedules.

The three CSOs supported during the phase out are:

  • Caritas Livingstone - working on energy in the southern province of Zambia
  • NECOS (Network for Environment Concerns and Solutions) - working on energy in the province of Lusaka
  • Caritas Mpika - working on beekeeping and forest management in Mpika district

participating-org.narrative: Network for Environment Concerns and Solutions
